description: Wheel Excitement Inc. is located directly south of the Rogers Centre and CN Tower, one block east of Spadina on the west side of the Radisson Admiral Hotel. We are connected to some of the most scenic bike trails in the city - the Martin Goodman Trail along the lakeshore, the Toronto Islands, Harbourfront Centre, The Beaches, the new HTO Park & much, much more.

reviews.title: Nice bike rental service on the harbourfront
text: We rented bicycles to go to the Toronto Islands. Bicycles were quite comfortable, pricing was good. Unfortunately one of the bikes had issues with the pedal gears (probably should have tested more when receiving the bikes). The bikes are comfortable but do look well used. Toronto city has good infrastructure for riding, despite road closures so you can even venture into the city for lunch in Kensington Market, for example, if you plan your route in advance to get through all the bicycle friendly roads.

reviews.title: Great rental experience!
text: The entire rental process, from arriving at the hiring outlet to returning our bikes later in the day, was slick and efficient. Helmets and baskets were included in the price. Locks were an extra $5. We asked for a full day rental, as it seemed our cheapest option. Our plan was to cycle the Toronto Islands as well as the Martin Goodman trail along the waterfront. The bikes were comfortable and well maintained.

We returned our bikes slightly earlier than expected and were pleasantly surprised with the way in which they calculated the cost per time. We ended up paying less than the full day hire fee. What a great business to deal with!

reviews.title: Great bike rental even in the winter!
text: Rented bikes to take over to the Toronto Islands. Shop is perfectly placed next to the cycle path which is great for allowing you to get used to the bikes (and for us the switch in the side of the road). No companies offering bike rentals in winter on the islands so it was great to find this place near the ferry terminal. Islands give a great view of Toronto but without the bikes, and everything being shut for the winter season, we would have probably just got the ferry straight back.
Reasonable prices for well maintained 3 gear bikes (Toronto is very flat so we didn’t have a want for anything more) and a helmet is included.

reviews.title: Superb location
text: Light and easy-to-carry bikes, and a large inventory so very unlikely to run out during peak times. Helpful staff and reasonable prices. Amazing location on the harbourfront right beside the Martin Goodman Trail that goes all the way from Burlington to Ajax!

reviews.title: Nice experience in Toronto by bike
text: I have been inToronto so many times but this time I want to do something different  also taking advantage of the good weather.
I decided to rent the bikes for all the family for the duration of our time in Toronto.
I found very easy by internet the shop WHEEL EXCITEMENT  best place to rent the bikes in Toronto,  good price and  great services.
Thank you again to Bruce.
Roberto from London

reviews.title: Bike ride on Toronto Island
text: Great quality bike, adjusted to my height and ready to go immediately upon arrival. Outstanding customer service, great location, right near the tiki Taxi to the island. And not being a bike owner myself I found the rental price of $22 including tax to be extremely reasonable. Not only that, it allowed me the opportunity to explore the entirety of the island including parts that I had never seen before in 25 years of living in Toronto! Great experience all around - I will definitely be using the service again this summer :-)

reviews.title: Really comfortable bikes
text: Helpful guy.  Fitted us with good pushbikes and helmets. We cycled to East Toronto one day then West Toronto next day.  We're visiting from Australia and in our 70s.  Perfect way to explore Toronto which has magnificent bike paths.

reviews.title: Great service
text: Very friendly staff, good bikes and service! Very nice to visit the city, harbourfront and Toronto islands by bike!

reviews.title: Good bike rental place
text: We went with our 2 kids (6 and 4 years old). The bike's condition were excellent and all the staff are very helpful. Although they didn't have bike suitable for our 6 years old, we rented a large family bike to carry the kids and it was also fun for them. Just need to be more careful when getting on and off the bike as it may fall. The pricing is quite reasonable for a shop in the city. We will definitely go there again if we are visiting TO in the future.

reviews.title: Good price and well serviced bikes
text: We wanted to rent some bikes to ride the waterfront trail downtown. I was going to rent the bikes through Bike Share Toronto, but from what I understand, you have to dock your bike every 30 minutes or risk a 1/2-hourly fee of $4 until you do this docking. I really didn't feel like having to keep track of this. Instead we found Wheel Excitement to rent a bike hourly or daily. The rates are great. The best thing is they had a variety of bikes, and the helmet is included with the rental. I recommend renting a bike through them vs. Bike Share. I plan on going back to Toronto and will rent a bike through Wheel Excitement again.

reviews.title: wheel excitement rollerblade rental - absolutely HORRIBLE
text: This is the worst customer service I have had in a long time....one person in store when I went in...possibly the owner since he claimed to be in business for 25 years.   What a joke!    He was rude and disrespectful.   Do not go near this place.

reviews.title: Great bikes, Great service
text: We rented bikes to cycle around Toronto and the islands, we had to put a credit card pre-auth on but that was no issue. Price was really reasonable for a 24hr rental which meant we didn't have to worry about being back before they closed. Bikes were great quality, really nice to rise and obviously well looked after- would rent here again :)

reviews.title: $100 deposit for bike share
text: I am unpleasantly surprised to find that Toronto's Transportation Department Bike Share has charged me $100 for using the bike for an hour. If you are not a bike share member, you can only use a credit card to pay for your rental, and the rental computer warns you a safety deposit of $250 "may" be charged to your account and can take up to ten days to be refunded to you, even if you return your bike within the agreed rental period. Fortunately I had enough money to spot the $100 deposit they charged me. I think it is ridiculous that this supposedly inexpensive leisure activity for locals and tourists can only be used by someone who can afford to have $250 go missing from his/her account for up to 10 days.

reviews.title: Bicycle Rental
text: Well located on water front trail. Good cruising bikes, well maintained. Reasonable prices and you only pay for what you use, so it's good for families with over ambitious expectations of how long they will/can ride for. Very helpful staff.

reviews.title: rented for a day on Toronto Island
text: We met the owner while having breakfast before going to the island. He said he rented bikes so we went to his store to check it out. We were happy we did. We knew they rented bikes on the Island but were concerned about the quality of the Island rentals. My wife said she liked her bike better than the one she owns at home. I believe the cost was comparable but it was worth it for the quality of the bikes and convenience of starting to ride right from the ferry.

reviews.title: Waste of time
text: The minute you walk in this place , you feel that something is not right. The shop is guarded by two old folks who should not be in a business of providing customer service , as they seem to be passionate about providing misleading and incorrect information.

We were taking part in Becel bike ride on 1 June 14 and arrived at the store at 8.30ish ( or thereabouts) to collect our bikes, both  Tom & Jerry ( not their real names) did their best to convince that we were too late to collect the bikes and participate in the ride , it's only after being persistent that they reluctantly gave us the bikes and when we arrived at the start line ( some 20 mins later ) , we were 10 mins before the cut off time ...in short , do hire your bikes , but do not trust what they say ...and look at their website ... There were the winners of the Toronto tourism award ... In 1999 , says it all

reviews.title: Bike Rental Toronto
text: Have used Wheel Excitement each time I have been to Toronto in recent years. First time I met Bruce was when we arranged a charity cycle from Lake Eyrie via Niagara Falls to Toronto so quite a lot of organisation and Bruce & team were extremely helpful. More recently visting family in TO and again Bruce made our cycles perfect. Wouldn't go anywhere else than WE
ADVICE - the "pay as you go" Bike Share scheme is VERY expensive

reviews.title: Good bikes and friendly service
text: We’ve rented two bikes at Wheel Excitement. The bikes were big enough for tall people and drove very smooth. The only disadvantage was that there was no mudguard on the bike.

reviews.title: Brilliant bike hire!
text: We arrived at about 10.00am and there were no queues and lots of choice on bike rentals.  Hired 4 bikes, helmets and locks which came to about £90 for 5 hours (probably a bit more expensive than in the UK).

That said, the bike rental shop was well positioned on the harbour front so we were able to zoom quickly to the Music Garden and statues at Ireland Park before doubling back and head to the Jack Lawton Ferry Terminal to head over to Hanson Point on the Islands with out bikes.  We cycled across the chain of 3 islands and caught the ferry back from Wards island..... much better than catching the ferry to Centre Island and hiring when we got there (the bike rental is not next to the ferry and there were longish queues at the rental place anyway).  Felt more likes local taking out bikes on the ferry!
The bikes were great, they all worked and the seats were comfy - tick!

reviews.title: Easy, fast...so glad we rented here.
text: Kabi was friendly, fast, efficient, and made us feel at ease. He gave us some good advice. So glad we rented here, then we took a water taxi out to the islands, and had a great time.

reviews.title: Super easy and friendly rentals - great way to see the city!
text: Great place to get started on seeing the city.  Super friendly and helpful.  Helped us pick the right bikes and gave recommendations as to what to see that is most appropriate for our age & abilities.  Very convenient & most excellent starting point right on lake-side bike trail.  We rented for 5 hours & got the extra $5 lock that allowed us to leisurely tour the water front a visit all of the sites we wanted.  And they include a helmet!!

reviews.title: This place made our trip to Toronto extra special!
text: We rented bikes on two separate days. Each time, they were super friendly and quick. The bikes were great quality, and the store location is perfect for access to many great biking options in the city. I was travelling with my son and they had a perfect bike and helmet in his size. A fantastic service that helps you see the city in a whole new way!

reviews.title: Extremely Friendly and Efficient
text: Great service and reasonable rates. Had issues with one of my bike with brake lines, rusted chains and they got everything all fixed up for under $100!! Highly Recommended. 1 day turn around time which is a plus.

reviews.title: Great Bikes , great spot and friendly people
text: The perfect spot for Bike Rental kn
Toronto. Best bikes and  loze to The ferry to the islands. For sure would rent again when in toronto

reviews.title: good service and reasonable rates
text: Our rental was for 24 hours which was great. I was able to keep the bike overnight at a friend's inside apartment and do more touring in the morning before returning at the required time. Friendly service.

reviews.title: Nice bikes, even nicer service
text: My wife and I rented bikes from Wheel Excitement on the recommendation by the concierge at our hotel.  I was considering using Toronto Bike Share, but their bikes don't come with locks, so you can only park them at their dedicated docking stations.  We wanted a little more flexibility, in case we saw a store or restaurant in a random place that we may have wanted to stop in to.

We picked up our bikes at around 12pm, and they were comfortable and funcional.  Both came with baskets, case we picked up something bulky.  We were told that the shop closes at 5pm to return the bikes.  First we rode the bikes up Spadina to China Town for lunch.  Then we rode back down to the Toronto Islands Ferry Terminal, behind the Westin hotel on Queens Quay.  We rode our bikes on Toronto Islands for a couple of hours, which I highly recommend.  However, since it is Winter, the ferry does not run as often as Summer, and I realized at about 4:40pm that the next ferry at 5pm would not get us back to the shop before closing.  I called the shop at about 5:07pm as soon as the ferry landed back on the mainland, and fortunately someone picked up.  I high tailed it back to the shop and they were nice enough to allow us to return the bikes at about 5:15pm, which was past closing time.  We were extremely appreciative of this kind gesture.
I highly recommend Wheel Experience for anyone in search of a quality bike for rent in Toronto, along with friendly and helpful service.
Dr. Kingstone Shih and Laura Meneses
Los Altos, CA USA

reviews.title: great
text: owner is so nice. great service, location, and bikes. toronto is a great biking city. i lost track of time and should have brought a light.
